Get dependencies:\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;bash\n   flutter pub get\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n2. Generate code:\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;bash\n   flutter pub run build_runner build --delete-conflicting-outputs\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n{{#use_firebase}}\n3. Configure Firebase (required):\n   - Update &#96;YOUR_FIREBASE_PROJECT_ID&#96; in &#96;flutterfire-config.sh&#96; with your Firebase project ID\n   - Run the configuration script for each flavor:\n     &#96;&#96;&#96;bash\n     ./flutterfire-config.sh dev\n     ./flutterfire-config.sh stg\n     ./flutterfire-config.sh prod\n     &#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n{{/use_firebase}}\n{{#use_firebase}}4{{^use_firebase}}3{{/use_firebase}}. **Important**: Rename the Android Kotlin directory to match your app ID:\n   - Move &#96;android/app/src/main/kotlin/id/logique/trial/&#96; to match your &#96;app_id&#96; structure\n   - For example, if your app_id is &#96;com.example.myapp&#96;, rename to &#96;android/app/src/main/kotlin/com/example/myapp/&#96;\n\n### Running the App\n\n&#96;&#96;&#96;bash\n# Development\nflutter run --flavor dev -t lib/main_dev.dart\n\n# Staging\nflutter run --flavor stg -t lib/main_stg.dart\n\n# Production\nflutter run --flavor prod -t lib/main_prod.dart\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n## Project Structure\n\n- &#96;lib/src/&#96; - Main source code\n  - &#96;feature/&#96; - Feature modules\n  - &#96;common_widget/&#96; - Reusable widgets\n  - &#96;routing/&#96; - GoRouter configuration\n  - &#96;theme/&#96; - App theming\n  - &#96;localization/&#96; - Localization files\n\n## Resources\n\n- [Flutter Documentation](https://docs.flutter.dev/)\n- [Riverpod Documentation](https://riverpod.dev/)\n- [GoRouter Documentation](https://pub.dev/packages/go_router)",

â†’ &#96;{{project_name}}&#96; and &#96;id.logique.trial&#96; â†’ &#96;{{app_id}}&#96;\n\n### File Handling Strategy\n\n- **Existing Files**: Smart merge preserving all Mason variables\n- **New Files**: Copied as-is from reference (with path/content mapping, no variables added)\n- **Deleted Files**: Kept in template (template-specific files are preserved)\n- **Binary Files**: Direct copy (images, fonts, etc.)\n\n### Path Transformations\n\nThe script automatically transforms:\n- Directory names: &#96;project-starter-ref&#96; â†’ &#96;{{project_name}}&#96;\n- Package names: &#96;id.logique.trial&#96; â†’ &#96;{{app_id}}&#96;\n- App names: &#96;\"Trial\"&#96; â†’ &#96;\"{{app_name}}\"&#96;\n- Project names: &#96;project-starter-ref&#96; â†’ &#96;{{project_name}}&#96;\n\n## Architecture\n\n### Components\n\n1. **sync-template.dart** - Main orchestration script with CLI\n2. **sync-template_merger.dart** - Smart merge logic for preserving Mason variables\n3. **sync-template_parser.dart** - Extracts and parses Mason variable blocks\n4. **sync-template_mapper.dart** - Handles path and content transformations\n5. **sync-template_config.dart** - Configuration and patterns\n6. **sync-template_impact.dart** - Impact analysis for identifying affected files\n7. **sync-template_interactive.dart** - Interactive file selection for choosing files to ignore\n\n## Examples\n\n### Example 1: Syncing pubspec.yaml\n\n**Reference (ref/project-starter-ref/pubspec.yaml):**\n&#96;&#96;&#96;yaml\nname: project-starter-ref\ndependencies:\n  firebase_core: 4.2.1\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n**Template (src/__brick__/{{project_name}}/pubspec.yaml):**\n&#96;&#96;&#96;yaml\nname: {{project_name}}\n{{#use_firebase}}\ndependencies:\n  firebase_core: 4.2.1\n{{/use_firebase}}\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n**After Sync:**\n&#96;&#96;&#96;yaml\nname: {{project_name}}\n{{#use_firebase}}\ndependencies:\n  firebase_core: 4.2.1\n{{/use_firebase}}\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\nThe &#96;{{#use_firebase}}&#96; block is preserved even though the reference doesn't have it.\n\n### Example 2: New File\n\nIf a new file &#96;lib/src/new_feature.dart&#96; is added to the reference, it will be:",

        "contents": "# Flutter Project Starter\n\nA Mason brick for scaffolding production-ready Flutter projects with flavors, Firebase, Riverpod, and modern tooling.\n\n## Overview\n\nThis repository contains a [Mason](https://github.com/felangel/mason) brick that generates a complete Flutter project structure with:\n\n- **Multi-environment Flavors**: Development, Staging, and Production\n- **State Management**: Riverpod 3.0.3 with code generation\n- **Routing**: GoRouter 17.0.0 with type-safe routes\n- **Local Database**: Sembast with encryption support\n- **HTTP Client**: Dio with Alice debugging inspector (optional)\n- **Firebase**: Core, Messaging, and FlutterFire CLI integration (optional)\n- **Responsive Design**: Flutter ScreenUtil\n- **Localization**: English and Indonesian (extensible, optional)\n- **Form Handling**: Flutter Form Builder with validators\n- **Custom Icons &amp; Splash**: Automated generation via Flutter Launcher Icons and Native Splash (optional)\n\n## Prerequisites\n\nBefore using this brick, ensure you have:\n\n1. **Flutter SDK** (&gt;= 3.38.0)\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;bash\n   flutter --version\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n2. **Mason CLI**\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;bash\n   dart pub global activate mason_cli\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n3. **FlutterFire CLI** (required only if &#96;use_firebase&#96; is enabled)\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;bash\n   dart pub global activate flutterfire_cli\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n4. **Firebase CLI** (required only if &#96;use_firebase&#96; is enabled, must be logged in)\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;bash\n   npm install -g firebase-tools\n   firebase login\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n## Installation\n\nAdd directly from Git in your global mason configuration:\n\n&#96;&#96;&#96;bash\nmason add starter --git-url https://github.com/Logique-ID/project-starter.git --git-path src\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n## Usage\n\n### Generate a New Project\n\nFrom the repository root (or anywhere if installed globally):\n\n&#96;&#96;&#96;bash\nmason make starter\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n### Optional Features\n\nThe brick supports several optional features that can be enabled or disabled:\n\n- **Firebase** (&#96;use_firebase&#96;): When enabled, includes Firebase Core, Messaging, and auto-configures FlutterFire CLI for all flavors. When disabled, Firebase dependencies and initialization code are excluded.\n- **Localization** (&#96;use_localization&#96;): When enabled, includes ARB-based localization with English and Indonesian support. When disabled, provides a &#96;StringHardcoded&#96; extension for hardcoded strings.",

        "contents": "The parent repo stores **one specific commit SHA** for each submodule (like a pinned version).\n\nTo update the parent to a newer submodule commit:\n\n1. Go into the submodule and pull new changes:\n\n&#96;&#96;&#96;bash\ncd ref/project-starter-ref\ngit pull origin main   # or whatever branch you use\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n2. Go back to the parent repo and stage the new submodule pointer:\n\n&#96;&#96;&#96;bash\ncd ../..               # back to project-starter\ngit status             # you'll see ref/project-starter-ref as modified\ngit add ref/project-starter-ref\ngit commit -m \"Update project-starter-ref submodule\"\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n**Tracking a Branch**\n\nYou can use a branch (e.g. &#96;dev&#96;) of &#96;project-starter-ref&#96; as your â€œactive referenceâ€.\n\n1. For your own development and &#96;sync-template.dart&#96;, you can just work on a branch inside the submodule:\n\n&#96;&#96;&#96;bash\ncd ref/project-starter-ref\ngit checkout dev          # or any branch you use for active development\ngit pull origin dev       # get latest\n\ncd ../..\ndart run scripts/sync-template.dart\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n2.  Parent repo tracking a branch (more automated)\n\nYou can tell Git that the submodule should **track a branch** (e.g. &#96;dev&#96;) instead of a fixed commit, then use &#96;--remote&#96; when updating:\n\n1. Configure branch in &#96;.gitmodules&#96;:\n\n&#96;&#96;&#96;ini\n[submodule \"ref/project-starter-ref\"]\n    path = ref/project-starter-ref\n    url = https://github.com/Logique-ID/project-starter-ref.git\n    branch = dev\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n2. Apply the config and commit it:\n\n&#96;&#96;&#96;bash\ngit submodule sync\ngit add .gitmodules\ngit commit -m \"Track dev branch for project-starter-ref submodule\"\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n3. When you want to update to latest &#96;dev&#96; in the parent:\n\n&#96;&#96;&#96;bash\ngit submodule update --remote --init --recursive\n# or, more specific:\ngit submodule update --remote ref/project-starter-ref\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n- &#96;--remote&#96; makes Git fetch the remote and checkout the **tip of the configured branch** (&#96;dev&#96;) instead of just the pinned SHA.\n- After this, you still need to commit in the parent:\n\n&#96;&#96;&#96;bash\ngit add ref/project-starter-ref\ngit commit -m \"Update project-starter-ref to latest dev\"\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n**Important: Template Variables in README**",

        "contents": "# Starter Brick\n\n[![Powered by Mason](https://img.shields.io/endpoint?url=https%3A%2F%2Ftinyurl.com%2Fmason-badge)](https://github.com/felangel/mason)\n\nA Flutter starter project brick with flavors (dev, stg, prod), Firebase, Riverpod, and more.\n\n_Generated by [mason][1]_\n\n## Features\n\n- **Flavors**: Development, Staging, and Production environments\n- **State Management**: Riverpod 3.0.3 with code generation\n- **Routing**: GoRouter 17.0.0\n- **Local Database**: Sembast with encryption\n- **HTTP Client**: Dio with Alice debugging\n- **Firebase**: Core, Messaging, and FlutterFire CLI configuration\n- **Responsive Design**: Flutter ScreenUtil\n- **Localization**: English and Indonesian\n- **Custom Icons**: Optional custom app icon with auto-generation\n- **Splash Screen**: Optional native splash screen\n\n## Usage\n\n&#96;&#96;&#96;bash\nmason make starter\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\nThis will generate a project directory named after your &#96;project_name&#96; value (e.g., &#96;my_app/&#96;).\n\n### Variables\n\n| Variable | Type | Description | Default |\n|----------|------|-------------|---------|\n| &#96;project_name&#96; | string | Project name (snake_case, used in pubspec.yaml) | &#96;my_app&#96; |\n| &#96;app_name&#96; | string | Display name shown on device | &#96;My App&#96; |\n| &#96;app_id&#96; | string | Bundle/application ID (e.g., com.example.myapp) | &#96;com.example.myapp&#96; |\n| &#96;custom_icon&#96; | boolean | Whether to use a custom app icon | &#96;false&#96; |\n| &#96;use_splash&#96; | boolean | Implement native splash screen | &#96;true&#96; |\n\n### Additional Prompts\n\nDuring generation, you'll also be asked for:\n\n- **Firebase Project ID**: Required for FlutterFire configuration\n- **Custom Icon Path**: Path to your icon file (if &#96;custom_icon&#96; is true)\n- **Splash Image Path**: Path to your splash image (if &#96;use_splash&#96; is true)\n\n## What Happens During Generation\n\n### Pre-Generation (pre_gen.dart)\n\n1. Prompts for Firebase project ID\n2. If &#96;custom_icon&#96; is true, prompts for icon file path\n3. If &#96;use_splash&#96; is true, prompts for splash image path\n\n### Post-Generation (post_gen.dart)\n\n1. Creates Kotlin package directory structure from &#96;app_id&#96;\n2. Runs &#96;flutterfire config&#96; for all three flavors (dev, stg, prod)",

        "contents": "# Template Sync Scripts\n\nAutomated synchronization system for updating Mason brick templates from reference projects while preserving all Mason/Mustache variable conditions.\n\n## Overview\n\nThe sync system updates the Mason brick template (&#96;src/__brick__/{{project_name}}/&#96;) from the reference project (&#96;ref/project-starter-ref/&#96;) while intelligently preserving all existing Mason variable blocks like &#96;{{#use_firebase}}...{{/use_firebase}}&#96;.\n\n## Usage\n\n### Basic Sync\n\nRun the sync script from the project root:\n\n&#96;&#96;&#96;bash\ndart run scripts/sync-template.dart\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n### Dry Run\n\nPreview changes without modifying files:\n\n&#96;&#96;&#96;bash\ndart run scripts/sync-template.dart --dry-run\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\nor\n\n&#96;&#96;&#96;bash\ndart run scripts/sync-template.dart -n\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n### Verbose Output\n\nSee detailed information about each file processed:\n\n&#96;&#96;&#96;bash\ndart run scripts/sync-template.dart --verbose\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\nor\n\n&#96;&#96;&#96;bash\ndart run scripts/sync-template.dart -v\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n### Sync Specific Directory\n\nSync only a specific directory or file:\n\n&#96;&#96;&#96;bash\ndart run scripts/sync-template.dart --path lib/src/routing\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n### Combined Options\n\n&#96;&#96;&#96;bash\ndart run scripts/sync-template.dart --dry-run --verbose --path lib/src\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n### Interactive File Selection\n\nChoose which files to sync interactively:\n\n&#96;&#96;&#96;bash\ndart run scripts/sync-template.dart --interactive\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\nor\n\n&#96;&#96;&#96;bash\ndart run scripts/sync-template.dart -i\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\nThis will:\n1. Analyze files using the same detection logic as &#96;--impact&#96; (only shows files that will be changed)\n2. Display files that will be changed (numbered list)\n3. Prompt you to select files to sync\n4. Show a preview of what will be synced vs skipped\n5. Ask for confirmation before proceeding\n\n**Note:** Only files that will actually be changed (new files, updated files, binary files) are shown in the selection list. Files that won't change are automatically excluded, just like in impact analysis.\n\n**Selection options:**\n- Enter numbers separated by commas: &#96;1,3,5&#96; (syncs files 1, 3, and 5)\n- Enter ranges: &#96;1-5&#96; (syncs files 1 through 5)\n- Enter &#96;all&#96; to sync all files\n- Enter &#96;none&#96; or press Enter to cancel",

Remove it like this:\n\n&#96;&#96;&#96;bash\n# 1. Remove the submodule entry from .gitmodules\ngit rm --cached ref/ref_app\n\n# 2. Restore files as regular directory\nmv ref/ref_app_backup ref/ref_app\n\n# 5. Add as regular files (not submodule)\ngit add ref/ref_app\n\n# 6. Commit\ngit commit -m \"Convert ref_app from submodule to regular directory\"\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n**Cloning the Repository with Submodules**\n\nBy default, &#96;git clone&#96; only clones the main repository. Submodules are separate repositories, so they require explicit initialization.\n\n**Option 1: Clone with &#96;--recursive&#96; (Recommended)**\n\nClone the parent repository and all submodules in one command:\n\n&#96;&#96;&#96;bash\ngit clone --recursive &lt;project-starter-repo-url&gt;\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\nOr use the shorter alias:\n\n&#96;&#96;&#96;bash\ngit clone --recursive-submodules &lt;project-starter-repo-url&gt;\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n**Option 2: Initialize After Cloning**\n\nIf you already cloned without &#96;--recursive&#96;:\n\n&#96;&#96;&#96;bash\n# Navigate to the cloned repository\ncd project-starter\n\n# Initialize and clone all submodules\ngit submodule update --init --recursive\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\nOr just initialize (without recursive if no nested submodules):\n\n&#96;&#96;&#96;bash\ngit submodule update --init\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n**Option 3: Configure Git to Auto-Initialize Submodules**\n\nSet this globally to auto-initialize submodules on clone:\n\n&#96;&#96;&#96;bash\ngit config --global submodule.recurse true\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\nAfter this, &#96;git clone&#96; will automatically initialize submodules.\n\n**Updating Submodule Reference**\n\nThe parent repo does **not** autoâ€‘update the submodule reference when new commits land in the submoduleâ€™s own repo.\n\nThe parent repo stores **one specific commit SHA** for each submodule (like a pinned version).\n\nTo update the parent to a newer submodule commit:",

Mason variables like &#96;{{project_name}}&#96; are only replaced when the brick is run and a project is generated. 'name: \"{{app_name}} [${match.group(1)!}]\"',\n    );\n    mapped = mapped.replaceAllMapped(\n      RegExp(r'name:\\s*\"Trial\"'),\n      (match) =&gt; 'name: \"{{app_name}}\"',\n    );\n\n    // Replace package/application IDs in various formats\n    mapped = mapped.replaceAll('id.logique.trial.dev', '{{app_id}}.dev');\n    mapped = mapped.replaceAll('id.logique.trial.stg', '{{app_id}}.stg');\n    mapped = mapped.replaceAll('id.logique.trial', '{{app_id}}');",
